content: On July 29, 1998, the Atlanta Braves honored the legendary Hank Aaron by celebrating the 25th anniversary of his historic 715th home run, which he hit on April 8, 1974. During the pre-game ceremony at Turner Field, Aaron was presented with a special commemorative plaque, and the Braves paid tribute to his incredible career and contributions to the game of baseball. This event underscored the franchise's deep connection to Aaron, who is still celebrated as one of the greatest players in baseball history.
